description:
It might be difficult to get a good night's sleep the night before a big interview, but we all know it helps.大型面试前一晚可能很难睡个好觉，但我们都知道睡眠很有帮助。

Now, new research shows that on top of helping people perform better, getting more sleep also makes individuals appear more intelligent to teachers and prospective employers.现在新的研究表明充足的睡眠除了帮助人们表现更好之外，还能让老师和未来老板觉着这个人更聪明。

A group of psychologists at the University of St Andrews, Scotland looked at 190 faces, belonging to children and adults.苏格兰圣安德鲁斯大学的一群心理学家研究了190张孩子和成年人的脸。

They measured how open the eyelids were and how curved the mouths were using face-processing software.他们用面部处理软件测量了眼睑的宽度和嘴的弯曲程度。

A panel of more than 200 people were then asked to rate the attractiveness and intelligence of these faces.一个200多人的小组被叫来评价这些面部是否有魅力、是否显得聪明。

The results showed that faces with a subtle frown and dropy eyes were perceived as less intelligent.结果表明有细微皱纹的脸和无神的眼睛给人感觉不够聪明。

Photographs were also taken of the same participants after a full night's sleep and after a night of restricted sleep.还给这些参与者拍了睡一宿好觉和睡不好觉的对比照片。

When the same individuals had less 'eyelid-openness' and a subtle frown it resulted in a significant decrease in their perceived intelligence.同一个人眼睑不够宽并带有细微皱纹时，给人感觉聪明程度大大降低。
